p: Fennel ( Foeniculum vulgare Mill.) is a hardy, perennial herb native to Mediterranean coasts and widely naturalized in many parts of the world. Fennel seed is a rich source of volatile oil, with its main compounds being fenchone and trans-anethole. Other components of the essential oil are limonene, camphene, estragole and α-pinene [ 55, 56]. The main constituents of the essential oils extracted from its leaves are trans-anethole, estragole, fenchone, and α-phellandrene; minor constituents are limonene, neophytadiene and phytol [ 57, 58].
